ada_lovelace.name: Ada Lovelace
ada_lovelace.description: Mathematician often recognized as the first computer programmer.

albert_einstein.name: Albert Einstein
albert_einstein.description: Theoretical physicist known for developing the theory of relativity.

amelia_earhart.name: Amelia Earhart
amelia_earhart.description: First female aviator to fly solo across the Atlantic Ocean.

carl_sagan.name: Carl Sagan
carl_sagan.description: Astronomer and science communicator known for research in extraterrestrial life.

cleopatra.name: Cleopatra
cleopatra.description: Last active ruler of the Ptolemaic Kingdom of Egypt

confucius.name: Confucius
confucius.description: Ancient philosopher who significantly influenced East Asian culture and philosophy.

frida_kahlo.name: Frida Kahlo
frida_kahlo.description: Mexican artist renowned for her symbolic self-portraits.

harriet_tubman.name: Harriet Tubman
harriet_tubman.description: Abolitionist who led hundreds of enslaved people to freedom.

isaac_newton.name: Isaac Newton
isaac_newton.description: Scientist known for his influential contributions to physics, including his laws of motion.

leonardo_da_vinci.name: Leonardo da Vinci
leonardo_da_vinci.description: High Renaissance polymath known for his diverse contributions to multiple fields.

louis_pasteur.name: Louis Pasteur
louis_pasteur.description: French biologist, microbiologist and chemist renowned for his discoveries of the principles of vaccination, microbial fermentation and pasteurization

mahatma_gandhi.name: Mahatma Gandhi
mahatma_gandhi.description: Leader of Indian nationalism who employed nonviolent resistance for independence.

marie_curie.name: Marie Curie
marie_curie.description: Physicist and chemist known for pioneering research on radioactivity.

maya_angelou.name: Maya Angelou
maya_angelou.description: An American poet, memoirist, and civil rights activist, she is best known for her series of seven autobiographies, which focus on her childhood and early adult experiences, the first and most famous of which is 'I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings'.

nelson_mandela.name: Nelson Mandela
nelson_mandela.description: Anti-apartheid revolutionary, political leader, and former President of South Africa.

nikola_tesla.name: Nikola Tesla
nikola_tesla.description: Inventor and engineer who greatly contributed to the development of electrical systems.

queen_victoria.name: Queen Victoria
queen_victoria.description: Queen of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland from 1837 until her death

robin_hood.name: Robin Hood
robin_hood.description: A heroic outlaw in English folklore who, according to legend, was a highly skilled archer and swordsman

sherlock_holmes.name: Sherlock Holmes
sherlock_holmes.description: A fictional private detective created by British author Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

dracula.name: Dracula
dracula.description: A vampire who is fabled to haunt the Carpathian Mountains

king_arthur.name: King Arthur
king_arthur.description: A legendary British leader who, according to medieval histories and romances, led the defense of Britain against Saxon invaders in the late 5th and early 6th centuries

hermione_granger.name: Hermione Granger
hermione_granger.description: A key character in the Harry Potter series, Harry's best friend, and a talented and intelligent witch

harry_potter.name: Harry Potter
harry_potter.description: The protagonist of J.K. Rowling's fantasy novel series about a young wizard and his adventures at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry

james_bond.name: James Bond
james_bond.description: A fictional British secret agent created by writer Ian Fleming, known for his sophistication, gadgets, and thrilling espionage missions

lara_croft.name: Lara Croft
lara_croft.description: The main protagonist of the Tomb Raider video game series, an archaeologist-adventurer who explores ancient tombs and uncovers hidden treasures

atticus_finch.name: Atticus Finch
atticus_finch.description: A fictional character in Harper Lee's novel 'To Kill a Mockingbird,' a lawyer known for his moral integrity and his defense of a wrongly accused African American man

snow_white.name: Snow White
snow_white.description: The protagonist of the fairy tale and Disney film 'Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs,' known for her beauty and kind-hearted nature

alice.name: Alice
alice.description: The central character in Lewis Carroll's 'Alice's Adventures in Wonderland,' a young girl who falls into a whimsical and nonsensical world

don_quixote.name: Don Quixote
don_quixote.description: The main character in Miguel de Cervantes' novel 'Don Quixote,' a middle-aged man who sets out on a quest to revive chivalry and battle imaginary foes

dorothy_gale.name: Dorothy Gale
dorothy_gale.description: The main character in many of the Oz novels by L. Frank Baum, best known from 'The Wonderful Wizard of Oz'.

charles_darwin.name: Charles Darwin
charles_darwin.description: English naturalist, geologist and biologist, best known for his contributions to the science of evolution.

winston_churchill.name: Winston Churchill
winston_churchill.description: British statesman, army officer, and writer who served as Prime Minister of the United Kingdom during the Second World War.

martin_luther_king_jr.name: Martin Luther King Jr.
martin_luther_king_jr.description: American Christian minister and activist who became the most visible spokesperson and leader in the Civil Rights Movement from 1955 until his assassination in 1968.

joan_of_arc.name: Joan of Arc
joan_of_arc.description: Nicknamed 'The Maid of Orléans', she is considered a heroine of France for her role during the Lancastrian phase of the Hundred Years' War.

beethoven.name: Ludwig van Beethoven
beethoven.description: German composer and pianist whose music is amongst the most performed of the classical music repertoire.

hercules.name: Hercules
hercules.description: A divine hero in Greek mythology, the son of Zeus and the mortal Alcmene.

frodo_baggins.name: Frodo Baggins
frodo_baggins.description: A main character in J. R. R. Tolkien's 'The Lord of the Rings' who carries the One Ring to Mount Doom.

luke_skywalker.name: Luke Skywalker
luke_skywalker.description: A key figure in the Star Wars universe, trained by Obi-Wan Kenobi and Yoda to become a Jedi and defeat the Galactic Empire.

elizabeth_bennet.name: Elizabeth Bennet
elizabeth_bennet.description: The protagonist in Jane Austen's 1813 novel 'Pride and Prejudice'.

darcy.name: Fitzwilliam Darcy
darcy.description: One of the two central characters in Jane Austen's 1813 novel 'Pride and Prejudice'.

huckleberry_finn.name: Huckleberry Finn
huckleberry_finn.description: The protagonist and narrator of novels 'The Adventures of Tom Sawyer' and 'Adventures of Huckleberry Finn', by Mark Twain.

romeo_juliet.name: Romeo and Juliet
romeo_juliet.description: The title characters in William Shakespeare's tragedy who fall in love despite their feuding families.

tarzan.name: Tarzan
tarzan.description: A fictional character, an archetypal feral child raised in the African jungle by the Mangani great apes; he later experiences civilization only to reject it and return to the wild as a heroic adventurer.

thomas_jefferson.name: Thomas Jefferson
thomas_jefferson.description: American statesman, diplomat, lawyer, architect, philosopher, and Founding Father who served as the third president of the United States from 1801 to 1809.

florence_nightingale.name: Florence Nightingale
florence_nightingale.description: British nurse, social reformer and statistician known as the founder of modern nursing.

william_shakespeare.name: William Shakespeare
william_shakespeare.description: English playwright, poet, and actor, widely regarded as the greatest writer in the English language and the world's greatest dramatist.

picasso.name: Pablo Picasso
picasso.description: Spanish painter, sculptor, printmaker, ceramicist, and theatre designer who spent most of his adult life in France and is regarded as one of the most influential artists of the 20th century.

charlie_chaplin.name: Charlie Chaplin
charlie_chaplin.description: English comic actor, filmmaker, and composer who rose to fame in the era of silent film and is best known for his character 'The Tramp'.

susan_b_anthony.name: Susan B. Anthony
susan_b_anthony.description: American social reformer and women's rights activist who played a pivotal role in the women's suffrage movement.

walt_disney.name: Walt Disney
walt_disney.description: American entrepreneur, animator, writer, voice actor and film producer who co-founded The Walt Disney Company.

neil_armstrong.name: Neil Armstrong
neil_armstrong.description: American astronaut and aeronautical engineer, and the first person to walk on the Moon.

muhammad_ali.name: Muhammad Ali
muhammad_ali.description: American professional boxer, activist, and philanthropist, widely regarded as one of the most significant and celebrated sports figures of the 20th century.

bilbo_baggins.name: Bilbo Baggins
bilbo_baggins.description: The protagonist of J. R. R. Tolkien's 'The Hobbit', Bilbo is a hobbit who is coerced into going on an adventure to reclaim the kingdom of Erebor from the dragon Smaug.

heathcliff.name: Heathcliff
heathcliff.description: A character in Emily Bronte's 'Wuthering Heights', Heathcliff is a passionate and vengeful man who endures a torturous love for Catherine Earnshaw.

nancy_drew.name: Nancy Drew
nancy_drew.description: The title character in a mystery series created by publisher Edward Stratemeyer, Nancy is a teenage detective who solves mysteries with her friends.

vito_corleone.name: Vito Corleone
vito_corleone.description: The patriarch of the Corleone family in Mario Puzo's 'The Godfather', Vito is an Italian immigrant who builds a mafia empire.

hamlet.name: Hamlet
hamlet.description: The Prince of Denmark, the title character, and the protagonist in Shakespeare's play 'Hamlet'. He struggles with the moral legitimacy of revenge, his own sanity, and the authenticity of his mother’s and friends’ seeming betrayal.

scarlett_o_hara.name: Scarlett O'Hara
scarlett_o_hara.description: The protagonist in Margaret Mitchell's 'Gone With the Wind', Scarlett is a Southern belle who survives the Civil War and Reconstruction.

jay_gatsby.name: Jay Gatsby
jay_gatsby.description: The title character of F. Scott Fitzgerald's 'The Great Gatsby', Gatsby is a millionaire and a man of mystery with a shady past and a love for Daisy Buchanan.

winnie_the_pooh.name: Winnie the Pooh
winnie_the_pooh.description: A character in A. A. Milne's 'Winnie-the-Pooh' series, Winnie the Pooh is a loveable bear known for his love of honey and his simple, but profound, wisdom.

holden_caulfield.name: Holden Caulfield
holden_caulfield.description: The protagonist of J.D. Salinger's 'The Catcher in the Rye', Holden is a teenager who navigates the challenges of adolescence and alienation.
